item.title: Are you sharing the wrong slides?
item.description: Do you share online the same slides that you used for your live presentation? Your online audience could be missing your message. Here is an easy solution that promotes great slide creation at the same time!
item.content:encoded: Do you share online the same slides that you used for your live presentation? Your online audience could be missing your message. Here is an easy solution that promotes great slide creation at the same time!

item.title: Ficod 2011 pdf (with notes)
item.description: I talk about the evolution of digital content into services, the role of sensors in the future of the web, about the idea of man-machine collaboration in internet services, and about the role of social networking in building content.
item.content:encoded: I talk about the evolution of digital content into services, the role of sensors in the future of the web, about the idea of man-machine collaboration in internet services, and about the role of social networking in building content.

item.title: Design for developers
item.description: These slides are from a 2 hour presentation called Design for Developers. The goal of Design for Developers is to teach interface design as a set of rules: there are some good default values for a lot of design decisions that you should remember, there is a “scientific” way of approaching things like alignment, even though many designers will tell you it’s something you should “feel”.
item.content:encoded: These slides are from a 2 hour presentation called Design for Developers. The goal of Design for Developers is to teach interface design as a set of rules: there are some good default values for a lot of design decisions that you should remember, there is a “scientific” way of approaching things like alignment, even though many designers will tell you it’s something you should “feel”.

The goal of Design for Developers is to teach interface design as a set of rules: there are some good default values for a lot of design decisions that you should remember, there is a “scientific” way of approaching things like alignment, even though many designers will tell you it’s something you should “feel”.
media:content.media:text: These slides are from a 2 hour presentation called Design for Developers. The goal of Design for Developers is to teach interface design as a set of rules: there are some good default values for a lot of design decisions that you should remember, there is a “scientific” way of approaching things like alignment, even though many designers will tell you it’s something you should “feel”.

item.title: Global Netflix Platform
item.description: Slides from QConSF Nov 19th, 2011 focusing this time on describing the globally distributed and scaled industrial strength Java Platform as a Service that Netflix has built and run on top of AWS and Cassandra. Parts of that platform are being released as open source - Curator, Priam and Astyanax.
item.content:encoded: Slides from QConSF Nov 19th, 2011 focusing this time on describing the globally distributed and scaled industrial strength Java Platform as a Service that Netflix has built and run on top of AWS and Cassandra. item.title: Visualizing the Agency of the Future
item.description: As head of JESS3’s strategy and operations for the last five years, COO & co-founder Leslie Bradshaw shares her insights and observations around how data, content and workforce are impacting and leveraging one another. Leslie posits: Whether you are an agency, brand, educator or public sector organization, these trends will all play a part of how you organize, think and produce. Originally presented for RefreshDC’s November meetup on 11/16/11.
item.content:encoded: As head of JESS3’s strategy and operations for the last five years, COO & co-founder Leslie Bradshaw shares her insights and observations around how data, content and workforce are impacting and leveraging one another. Leslie posits: Whether you are an agency, brand, educator or public sector organization, these trends will all play a part of how you organize, think and produce. Originally presented for RefreshDC’s November meetup on 11/16/11.

item.title: From destination social to dispersed social: 10 trends in social media
item.description: Thoughts on why the new social network won’t need to be a destination but will add social context to every on-line interaction, and 10 trends that shed some light on this.

item.title: Introducing Snap Empower - the Hottest New Flash Interactions Builder
item.description: Snap! by Lectora® and Snap! Empower change the PowerPoint e-Learning market forever. For only $99, create engaging Flash content in minutes. Absolutely no learning curve and no more breaking the bank. Snap! by Lectora truly reinvents the term ‘rapid’ by providing you with easy-to-use e-Learning software to create stunning courses, presentations, and fun Flash content and Snap! Empower enables anyone to create robust Flash animations quickly and easily. It’s time for you to be the hero. With Snap! by Lectora, you’ll save time, money, and effort developing and distributing engaging Flash content, making you the envy in the office. Excite learners and engage your audience with compelling Flash courses and interactive presentations. e-Learning never looked so good. With Snap! Empower™, the hottest new Flash interactions builder, you can use any of the easy templates included or build your own custom Flash interactions. And with a price tag of only $99, Snap! Empower makes that decision easier than ever. Create fun Flash content without the need for Flash skills and post it instantly on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and YouTube in just one click.
